aircraft.value: Viper Strike-3 - AC-5672-678 at Zone-4 Facility

defect_observed.value: Cargo hook release malfunction. Malfunction reported by flight crew.

findings.value: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Landing Gear component. Physical examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.

corrective_action.value: Clean and re-lubricate affected assemblies per technical manual

preventive_action.value: Enhance operator training on proper usage procedures

remarks_investigation.value: Investigation completed as per established procedures. All findings documented.

remarks_design.value: Design review completed. No design modification required. Component replacement as per maintenance manual is adequate. Date: 25/12/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta

remarks_quality.value: Dept. Quality control procedures verified. Recommend periodic surveillance of manufacturing facility. Date: 27/12/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair

remarks_user.value: (Project):(if applicable) Fleet experience reviewed. Similar occurrences noted on other platforms. Support fleet-wide inspection. Date: 28/12/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel

remarks_ordaqa.value: (Quality Aspects) From quality standpoint, root cause analysis is thorough. Corrective measures are appropriate. Concur. Date: 30/12/2024 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar

remarks_cemilac.value: / RCMA (Design Aspects) Certification review completed. Proposed modifications do not affect type design approval. Acceptable. Date: 31/12/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair

Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Critical
b) Defect Observed: Cargo hook release malfunction. Malfunction reported by flight crew.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Age-related degradation of elastomeric components
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Landing Gear component. Physical
examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Clean and re-lubricate affected assemblies per technical manual
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Enhance operator training on proper usage procedures
d) Attributable Code: U - Lapses on the part of User
